intro: Sceletium tugwelliae, commonly known as Kanna, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves contain psychoactive compounds, including kanna alkaloids, which have been used traditionally for their calming effects. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and resilience in harsh climates.
